reasoning: Manic episodes are primarily associated with Bipolar Disorder. Using bipolar disorder incidence as proxy: ~15 per 100k person-years based on epidemiological literature. Confidence moderate due to lack of 2005-specific data and symptom-based rather than disease-based classification.
source: Merikangas KR et al. (2007). Lifetime and 12-month prevalence of bipolar spectrum disorder in the National Comorbidity Survey replication. Arch Gen Psychiatry. 64(5):543-552
